pageContent: Objective: Androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) for the management of prostate cancer results in a range of side effects including sexual dysfunction. Exercise is proposed as a potentially effective therapy to counteract changes in sexual function. The current study explored the impact of ADT on men's sexuality and the effect of exercise on this experience.

metaData.source:
Sexual dysfunction following therapy for cancer of the prostate, testis, and penis
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/399230/
